items.title: Unneeded dependencies on pastel/pylev
items.body: The code uses were dropped in commit 132ad3e2d59addbe87ee182d8444d10e58104944 (Update codebase to make it a wrapper for clikit) and clikit properly depends on both. Since they're not directly used by cleo, they could be dropped from the dependencies here.

items.title: Binary dependecy ``hiddeninput.exe`` is really needed?
items.body:
Hello,

I am concerned about why is there a binary executable bundled in the package (I am referring to ``cleo/resources/bin/hiddeninput.exe``). This executable provides no information about its origin, has no digital signature and I don't believe it is the best practice to distribute it with the package. In addition, I see it is compiled using the Visual C 2010 runtime, which might not be satisfied on all Windows computers running Python (from Python 3.5, the interpreter only requires the Visual C 2015 runtime). 

Some alternatives that I suggest are:
- using the ``getpass`` builtin module (https://docs.python.org/3/library/getpass.html ) which is cross-platform.
- distribute it as a binary extension (publishing its code in the package and require it to be built when installing the package). This method can raise the popular error ``error: Unable to find vcvarsall.bat`` as most Windows distributions come without a C/C++ compiler, error which is hard to work around (requires installation of extra packages from Microsoft).

Let me know what you think,
Have a nice day!

items.title: Hint at expected/default input for `confirm` command
items.body:
I just spent an embarrassing amount of time absent-mindedly hitting the `return` key to agree to running my orator migrations and wondering why they wouldn't have any effect.

Maybe hinting at what kind of input is expected would be helpful?

**cleo**

items.title: Cleo 0.4 with fish/zsh : Unable to hide secret
items.body:
I was just trying the library and just for test I added a secret prompt. But every time when I run the application I get the exception "Unable to hide secret". At first I thought that it is because of [fish shell](http://fishshell.com/), but switching to zsh but the exception still comes.

The code in the handle function:

``` python
        if name:
            text = '<info>Hello %s</info>' % name
        else:
            password = self.secret("Please enter a secret")
            text = '<info>Hello %s</info>' % password
```

items.title: pip install cleo adds test folder to site-packages
items.body:
When I install Cleo using pip, in addition to cleo, it adds the cleo test directory. 
I believe this is because `setup.py` `find_packages` is not excluding the test directories.

items.title: Option shortcut only work with single characters
items.body: If I set up an option with a shortcut like `s3`, or `vv`, or `vvv` it doesn't work.

items.title: input::is_interactive always returns False
items.body:
if I use the option `-n` or `--no-interaction` input returns False, if I do not use the options input returns False.

I'm I correct to assume these should affect the output of the `is_interactive()` method?

Thank you

items.title: `--no-interaction (-n)` option do not work with dialog helper
items.body:
The code in the documentation

``` py
dialog = self.get_helper_set().get('dialog')
if dialog.ask_confirmation(
    output_,
    '<question>Continue with this action?</question>',
    False
):
    return
```

should be ignored if the `--no-interaction` or `-n` option is set.

Should the dialog helper `ask` and `ask_confirmation` methods  take the input object and check for this option?

``` py
def ask(self, input_, output_, question, default=None, autocomplete=None):
    if not input_.is_interactive():
        return default
    # ....
```

items.title: `ProgressHelper.finish()` does not fill in the remainder of the progress bar
items.body: If I call the `progress.finish()` the progress bar will not fill up, making it look like the process was incomplete if for some reason not all of the steps where added.

items.title: DialogHelper.ask() method raises an AttributeError in Python 3
items.body:
When DialogHelper.ask() method is called the line 106 raises an AttributeError in Python 3:

``` python
ret = input_stream.readline(4096)
```

items.body:
The width of a column with UTF-8 chars is broken.

```
+--------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+

| U Spiritky                           | Mgr. Josef Sluka                      |
| Hero                                 | Cognito.cz, s.r.o.                    |
| Dobré účetnictví                 | APOGEO, s.r.o.                        |
| Ústnípéče.cz                     | Apollonia Dental s.r.o.               |
```

items.title: Bypass Command.configure() method
GreetCommand demo as object
items.body:
Hello,

I just try the demo GreetCommand from your doc.
The first one work but not the object version.

When I execute it I have the following:

```
manu@Uvito:~/workspace/commander$ ./console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./console", line 8, in <module>
    application.add(GreetCommand())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cleo/commands/command.py", line 36, in __init__
    self.configure()
TypeError: configure() takes no arguments (1 given)
```

But I don't understand wich argument must be gived.

items.title: Validators and adaptors
items.body:
Implement validators and adaptors to be able to validate input data before the command gets executed.

``` python
InputArgument('foo', InputArgument.REQUIRED,
              description='A Foo argument',
              validator=int)

InputOption('bar', 'b', InputOption.VALUE_REQUIRED,
            description='A bar option',
            validator=Boolean())
```

items.title: Options are not taken into account
items.body: Whenever options are defined (`<options=bold>Foo</>`), those are not taken into account.

items.title: Autocompletion
items.body:
Cleo applications lack commands autocompletion.
We should be able to hit [TAB] to have the autocompletion triggered.

items.title: Add commands with decorators
Extra carriage returns when coloring the progress bar
items.body:
The ProgressHelper outputs extra carriage returns when coloring the progress bar.

``` python
from cleo import ProgressHelper, ConsoleOutput()

progress = ProgressHelper()
progress.set_bar_character('<comment>=</comment>')

steps = 10
progress.start(ConsoleOutput(), steps)

for _ in range(steps):
    progress.advance()

progress.finish()
```

items.title: Hide user's response in DialogHelper
items.body: Add the possibility to hide the user's response in the DialogHelper class.

items.title: UnicodeDecodeError in StreamOutput.do_write() method.
items.body: An UnicodeDecodeError is raised when passing non-ascii message to StreamOutput.do_write() method.

items.title: Pluralize modules names
items.body: The modules should have pluralized names (commands, formatters, helpers, inputs, outputs, testers).

items.title: Fully tests code
items.body: The code needs to be fully tested.
